intro: Galarhoeus andrachnoides, commonly known as the Andean mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and evergreens adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are leathery and evergreen, providing year-round structure in its alpine habitat. Galarhoeus andrachnoides is well adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 3,000 meters.
